member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph
member.summary: Represents an async method as a directed graph. Control will enter through an "event" node, which can route signals through a network of other nodes that perform actions. Use to create a completely blank graph, or to create a graph that handles an event matching the signature of a particular delegate.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph.TargetDefinition
member.summary: The definition of the graph input that represents the target of the graph.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph.TargetOutput
member.summary: The output of the graph's entry node that represents the target of the graph.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph.SourceLocation
member.summary: Identifies where this instance was deserialized from.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph.NodeLibrary
member.summary: Library of node definitions available for use by this action graph.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph.Nodes
member.summary: Set of nodes added to this action graph.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph.Links
member.summary: Set of links added between nodes in this action graph.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph.Variables
member.summary: Set of variables added to this action graph.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph.UserData
member.summary: Arbitrary named values stored in this action graph, which will be included during serialization. Values must be serializable to JSON.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph.InputNode
member.summary: Entry point of the graph.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph.PrimaryOutputNode
member.summary: Primary output of the graph.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraph.OutputNodes
member.summary: Nodes that emit return values or output signals from this graph to the caller.

member.summary: Remove a node from this action graph. Any links into or out of the node will also be removed.

member.summary: Creates a completely blank action graph. This won't be invokable until an event node is added.
member.param: Source of node definitions for the new action graph.

member.summary: Creates an action graph with an event node matching the signature of .

Delegate type to match the signature of.

member.summary: Creates an action graph with an event node matching the signature of delegate type .

member.summary: Wrapped action graph.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.IActionGraphDelegate.Delegate
member.summary: Delegate that is implemented by , with default arguments supplied by . This delegate will remain up-to-date even if the wrapped graph is modified, or default argument dictionary changes.

member.summary: The type that will contain when compiled.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.IActionGraphDelegate.Defaults
member.summary: Dictionary of default arguments for any graph input parameters that aren't supplied by delegate parameters.

member.summary: Wrapper for an invokable as a delegate, with optional overridden input values.
member.typeparam: Delegate type for the compiled graph.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraphDelegate`1._outerDelegate
member.summary: Lazily compiled once, wraps compiling (if changed) and then calling it.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraphDelegate`1._innerDelegate
member.summary: Lazily compiled each time is called if has been modified.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ActionGraphDelegate`1.BuildOuterDelegate
member.summary: Builds a delegate that calls the wrapped , supplying any default arguments from . This delegate will remain up-to-date even if the wrapped graph is modified, or default argument dictionary changes.

member.summary: Gets a delegate implementing the current configuration of with default arguments provided by , (re)compiling if needed.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ISourceLocation
member.summary: Interface for types that identify the source of an .

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.SerializationOptions
member.summary: Controls how s are (de)serialized.
member.param: Add this input to any graphs deserialized in this scope, usually representing a "this" parameter holding the object this graph is embedded in. When serializing, omit this input from the serialized graph because we know it will be added automatically when deserializing.

Re-use instances from this cache when deserializing, matching by . Graphs will be added to the cache when serializing or deserializing in this scope. When serializing, if is true, a minimal graph reference stub will be written instead of full graphs.
For debugging / editors, describe where graphs deserialized in this scope came from.
When deserializing, maps any graph s encountered.
If true, and a is provided, write a reference stub when serializing graphs instead of the full JSON.
If true, replace cached instance when deserializing. Otherwise, it'll only be replaced if its differs.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.SerializationOptions.#ctor(Facepunch.ActionGraphs.InputDefinition,Facepunch.ActionGraphs.IActionGraphCache,Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ISourceLocation,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.Guid,System.Guid},System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls how s are (de)serialized.
member.param: Add this input to any graphs deserialized in this scope, usually representing a "this" parameter holding the object this graph is embedded in. When serializing, omit this input from the serialized graph because we know it will be added automatically when deserializing.

Re-use instances from this cache when deserializing, matching by . Graphs will be added to the cache when serializing or deserializing in this scope. When serializing, if is true, a minimal graph reference stub will be written instead of full graphs.
For debugging / editors, describe where graphs deserialized in this scope came from.
When deserializing, maps any graph s encountered.
If true, and a is provided, write a reference stub when serializing graphs instead of the full JSON.
If true, replace cached instance when deserializing. Otherwise, it'll only be replaced if its differs.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.SerializationOptions.ImpliedTarget
member.summary: Add this input to any graphs deserialized in this scope, usually representing a "this" parameter holding the object this graph is embedded in. When serializing, omit this input from the serialized graph because we know it will be added automatically when deserializing.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.SerializationOptions.Cache
member.summary: Re-use instances from this cache when deserializing, matching by . Graphs will be added to the cache when serializing or deserializing in this scope. When serializing, if is true, a minimal graph reference stub will be written instead of full graphs.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.SerializationOptions.SourceLocation
member.summary: For debugging / editors, describe where graphs deserialized in this scope came from.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.SerializationOptions.GuidMap
member.summary: When deserializing, maps any graph s encountered.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.SerializationOptions.WriteCacheReferences
member.summary: If true, and a is provided, write a reference stub when serializing graphs instead of the full JSON.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.SerializationOptions.ForceUpdateCached
member.summary: If true, replace cached instance when deserializing. Otherwise, it'll only be replaced if its differs.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.SerializationOptions.Empty
member.summary: Default empty .

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.MessageLevel
member.summary: Severity level of a validation message.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.MessageLevel.Info
member.summary: Purely informative, there's nothing to fix.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.MessageLevel.Warning
member.summary: Suggests that something might not be intended, but isn't an error.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.MessageLevel.Error
member.summary: Something is incorrect and must be fixed in order to pass validation.

member.summary: Action graph this element belongs to.

member.summary: Parent element in the graph. Parents will list all validation messages of their children.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ValidationExtensions.HasErrors(Facepunch.ActionGraphs.IMessageContext)
member.summary: Returns true if any contained validation messages are errors. An action graph can't be invoked if it has any errors.

member.summary: Used to re-use instances when deserializing.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.INodeAttribute
member.summary: Used to define ActionGraph nodes using static methods, properties, or constructors.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.INodeAttribute.Identifier
member.summary: A unique name to identify this node type.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.NodeAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Used to define ActionGraph nodes using static methods, properties, or constructors.
member.param: A unique name to identify this node type.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.IPureAttribute
member.summary: Declares a method to not have any side effects, it only performs a calculation using its inputs and outputs a result.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.IImpureAttribute
member.summary: Declares a method to have side effects, even if it's declared as readonly.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.IPropertyAttribute
member.summary: For binding in methods marked with a , this parameter should only be configurable in the inspector as a property and not have a dedicated input.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ITargetAttribute
member.summary: For binding in methods marked with a , this parameter represents the target instance object the method is executed on.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.IExposeWhenCachedAttribute
member.summary: Declares that instances of the marked type can't be cached in a . For example, if they might contain an ID that needs to get fixed up post serialization.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.IAlwaysInvokedAttribute
member.summary: Marks an output signal that will always be dispatched before the default output signal. Used on a parameter of a method marked with .

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.INodeDefinitionAttribute
member.summary: Marks a class extending that should be automatically added to a when is called.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Compilation.ValueScopes
member.param: Scopes for each signal output of action nodes.
Scopes for each input that needs to be evaluated each time it is accessed.
Scopes for each signal output of action nodes.
Scopes for each input that needs to be evaluated each time it is accessed.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Compilation.ValueScopes.FromSignalOutput
member.summary: Scopes for each signal output of action nodes.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Compilation.ValueScopes.FromValueInput
member.summary: Scopes for each input that needs to be evaluated each time it is accessed.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Compilation.IOutputValue
member.summary: Describes a node output in this scope. It can either have a local variable that gets set during the body of its node, or a constant expression that gets defined during the body.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Compilation.ValueScope
member.summary: Wraps a set of value inputs of action nodes that should be evaluated at the same time. Each referenced expression node in the scope will be evaluated at most once, so if the result of a node is used multiple times it will have the same value. This is both an optimization, and expected behaviour if things like random numbers are sampled.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Compilation.ValueScope.Parameter
member.summary: The input or output parameter this scope was created from.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Compilation.ValueScope.Parent
member.summary: The scope immediately containing this one. The graph input node has no scope.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Compilation.ValueScope.ActionValueInputs
member.summary: Inputs on action nodes included in this scope. This doesn't include inputs of referenced expression nodes.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Compilation.ValueScope.AllowCaching
member.summary: If false, we need to re-evaluate the scope each time an input is accessed.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.AssignmentKind
member.summary: Operations accessor nodes can perform.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.AssignmentKind.Set
member.summary: Replace the old value with the new value.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.AssignmentKind.Add
member.summary: Replace the old value with old + new.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.AssignmentKind.Subtract
member.summary: Replace the old value with old - new.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.AssignmentKind.Multiply
member.summary: Replace the old value with old * new.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.AssignmentKind.Divide
member.summary: Replace the old value with old / new.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.AssignmentKind.Increment
member.summary: Replace the old value with old + 1.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.AssignmentKind.Decrement
member.summary: Replace the old value with old - 1.

member.summary: A lazily evaluated node without any signals.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.NodeKind.Action
member.summary: A node that performs an action when receiving an input signal.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ParameterFlags.Missing
member.summary: We don't have a valid definition for this parameter.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ParameterFlags.Required
member.summary: This parameter must have a value / link, and has no default value.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ParameterFlags.Primary
member.summary: This is the primary input / output signal.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.PropertyFlags.AlwaysSerialize
member.summary: Always serialize this property, even if it has the default value.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.InputFlags.Target
member.summary: This input represents the this parameter of a method.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.InputFlags.NotAlwaysAccessed
member.summary: This input is conditionally accessed, so its source should be lazily evaluated.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.InputFlags.NoCaching
member.summary: This input should be evaluated each time it is accessed, instead of being cached.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.OutputFlags.AlwaysInvoked
member.summary: This output signal will always be triggered.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.OutputFlags.NotAwaited
member.summary: The containing node won't await this output signal's completion.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.DisplayInfo.ParameterPattern
member.remarks:
Pattern:
\\{\\s*(?<name>[a-zA-Z_]+)\\s*(?:\\:\\s*(?<format>[^}|]+\\s*))?(?:\\|\\s*(?<default>[^}]*)\\s*)?\\}
Explanation:
Match '{'.
Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
"name" capture group.
Match a character in the set [A-Z_a-z] greedily at least once.
Match a whitespace character greedily any number of times.
Optional (greedy).
Match ':'.
Match a whitespace character greedily any number of times.
"format" capture group.
Match a character in the set [^|}] greedily at least once.
Match a whitespace character greedily any number of times.
Optional (greedy).
Match '|'.
Match a whitespace character greedily any number of times.
"default" capture group.
Match a character other than '}' greedily any number of times.
Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
Match '}'.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link
member.summary: A link connects one to a . They can either transmit values or signals. A signal will trigger the receiving node to act when the sending node fires its output.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.Target
member.summary: The receiving node's input.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.Source
member.summary: Where this link retrieves its value from.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.ActionGraph
member.summary: The action graph containing this link.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.IsSignal
member.summary: If true, this link will transmit a signal from an action node to another.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.Type
member.summary: The value type being transmitted by the link.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.TargetType
member.summary: The value type the target requires from this link.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.IsArrayElement
member.summary: If true, this link is supplying one element of an input that accepts an array.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.ArrayIndex
member.summary: If is true, this is the index of the element in the receiving array.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.UserData
member.summary: Arbitrary named values stored in this link, which will be included during serialization. Values must be serializable to JSON.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.IsValid
member.summary: Becomes false when this link is removed.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.Collapse
member.summary: Collapses any no-op nodes to find the root source of this link.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.Remove
member.summary: Remove this link from the action graph, disconnecting it from the source and target.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.TryGetConstant(System.Object@)
member.summary: If this link is from a source, return true and output the constant value.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.TryGetVariable(Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Variable@)
member.summary: If this link is from a source, return true and output the referenced variable.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Link.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string with the format "Link({Source}, {Target})".

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Node
member.summary: The main building block of an action graph. Represents either an action or expression. An action node has input and output signals, and will act only when receiving a signal. Expression nodes have only input and output values, and will be evaluated lazily when one of its outputs is requested.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Node._sourceModel
member.summary: Keep hold of the model this node was deserialized from if there were any exceptions, so we can safely round-trip serialize even in the worst case. This will get cleared if any changes are made to the node.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Node.SortedIndex
member.summary: Order of this node, such that any nodes linked to its inputs have a smaller index. Used during validation.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Node.ForceAsync
member.summary: True if executing this node is async because one of its outputs involves running another async node. Used during validation.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Node.IsAsync
member.summary: Does the execution of this node produce an async task. Used during validation.

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Node.Id
member.summary: Unique id of this node in the containing .

member.name: P:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Node.Parent
member.summary: Parent of a nested node.

member.summary: Arbitrary named values stored in this node, which will be included during serialization. Values must be serializable to JSON.

member.summary: Constant named values stored in this node.

member.summary: If true, this input accepts an array of values. Each element can be connected to a different output with or .

member.summary: If true, this input receives a signal that will cause the parent node to act.

member.name: T:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.NodeBinding
member.summary: A collection of named node properties, inputs, and outputs with specific types, as provided by a . Bindings may depend on the property values or currently linked input types of a node.
member.param: Display information for the bound node.
Named constant values stored in a node.
Named inputs that can be provided either from the outputs of other nodes, or with constant values.
Named outputs that can be connected to the inputs of other nodes.
Can contain warnings or errors if this binding isn't fully valid.
Optional binding target data used by .

member.summary: Load a type from an identifier, as produced by .

member.summary: Gets a named property declared on the given type. Should return null if the property isn't found, or if it isn't allowed to be accessed.

Property name.

Field name.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ITypeLoader.CanRead(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Returns true if is allowed to read from this property. Basic checks, like if a get method exists, will have already been performed.

member.name: M:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.ITypeLoader.CanWrite(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Returns true if is allowed to write to this property. Basic checks, like if a set method exists, will have already been performed.

member.summary: Returns true if is allowed to read from this field.

member.summary: Returns true if is allowed to read from this field. Basic checks, like if it is marked , will have already been performed.

member.param: Generic type definition with one or more open type parameters.

member.summary: Returns the name of the variable.

member.name: F:Facepunch.ActionGraphs.Variable._sourceType
member.summary: Keep hold of the node the variable type was deserialized from if there were any exceptions, so we can safely round-trip serialize even in the worst case. This will get cleared if any changes are made to the variable.
